intro: Ternstroemia hemsleyi var. dentatobracteata, commonly known as the serrated bract ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Theaceae family, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in shaded environments. The varietal name 'dentatobracteata' refers to the serrated bracts that surround its flowers, adding to its visual appeal.
